titles.title: To eliminate the daily newspaper cross-ownership rule of the Federal Communications Commission.
To eliminate the daily newspaper cross-ownership rule of the Federal Communications Commission.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.summary: This bill eliminates the Federal Communications Commission's broadcast/newspaper cross-ownership ban, which prohibits a single entity, or parties under common control, from owning a daily newspaper and a full-power commercial broadcast station (AM, FM, or television) in the same market.
